page.title: 02HOME FOR THE ELDERLY
page.content: Greengarth has 45 permanent residents with a room each,5 communal day rooms with T.V. ,a dining room,sleucing rooms,shared toilets and bathrooms with aids.There are 28 staff officers, nurses,cleaners, and cooks.The residents are between 68 yrs and 102 yrs old suffer from senile dementia arthritis, and homesickness at first.There are aids like walking frames,ripplebeds,mechanical arm extensions,electric and non electric wheelchairs.They keep Â£7.15 from their pension.A hairdresser comes twice a week,a chiropodist monthly,a church service weekly,an organist weekly, bingo,music and movement sessions.It is expensive to run. The money comes from social services and the resident's pension.
